io.github.ddimitrov.nuggets

Class Functions

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.github.ddimitrov.nuggets.Functions

  • public final class Functions
extends Object

    Entry Point Provides decorators and combinators for common Java functional interfaces. All methods are threadsafe.

    • Method Detail

      • sup

        @NotNull
public static <T> @NotNull Supplier<T> sup(@NotNull
                                                    @NotNull String name,
                                                    @NotNull
                                                    @NotNull Supplier<T> delegate)
        Decorates a supplier with a toString(), so that it can be printed and logged. The resulting supplier behaves in any other way like the delegate.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the generic type of the decorated supplier return value.
        Parameters:
        name - the string to be returned on toString(). Needs to start and end with a letter, can not be empty.
        delegate - the supplier to decorate.
        Returns:
        a supplier that behaves like delegate, but when printed prints as name

      • fallback

        @SafeVarargs
 @NotNull
public static <T,R> @NotNull Function<T,R> fallback(boolean failFast,
                                                                           @Nullable
                                                                           @Nullable Predicate<R> approveResult,
                                                                           @NotNull
                                                                           Function<T,R>... functions)

        Tries multiple functions in the specified order and returns the first result that passes a predicate, optionally ignoring exceptions. Throws DispatchException if none of the fallback functions returned a good result, wrapping all fallback failures as suppressed. If failFast was specified and any of the fallbacks throws an exception, it is immediately rethrown.

        Design notes: Ideally we would like this combinator to be a macro method, applicable to any functional interface that returns a value (non-void). We have decided to dispatch Functions, as these show up as the most common functional interfaces in the wild. Alternative design is to dispatch Suppliers, and force the caller to tunnel the functional parameters using closures, but that makes the more common case uglier. Going to the other extreme, we could have dispatched BiFunctions, and accommodated the Function use-case by requiring the client to adapt the result using partial application.

        Type Parameters:
        T - the function argument generic type
        R - the function return generic type
        Parameters:
        failFast - if true, as soon as a function throws exception, we'll rethrow it and skip trying the remaining fallback functions. If false, when a function throws an exception we just continue with the remaining fallback functions. If we try all exceptions and didn't find a result all these exceptions will be rethrown as Throwable.suppressedExceptions
        approveResult - a predicate that decides whether we shall return the result of a function or try the next one. If all functions are tried and none matched the predicate, this method will throw DispatchException
        functions - a functions to be tried one after another until one returns a result that matches the approveResult predicate. Exceptions are swallowed if failFast is true and rethrown if false.
        Returns:
        a function that dispatches through the fallbacks, based on the strategy determined by failFast and approveResult
        Throws:
        DispatchException - if failFast==false or none of the results matched the predicate. If failFast==true we would rethrow immediately if any of the fallbacks throws exception.

      • tap

        @NotNull
public static <T> @NotNull UnaryOperator<T> tap(@NotNull
                                                         @NotNull Consumer<T> c)
        Creates an identity function, intercepting the function argument for inspection or manipulation. It can be used with Function.compose(Function) to intercept the argument of a function and with Function.andThen(Function) to intercept the result.
        Type Parameters:
        T - generic type for inferrence
        Parameters:
        c - consumer operating on the function parameter
        Returns:
        an identity function calling c on its argument/result

      • yes

        @NotNull
public static <T> @NotNull Predicate<T> yes(@NotNull
                                                     @NotNull Consumer<T> c)
        Creates a fixed value true predicate, intercepting the predicate argument for inspection or manipulation. It can be used with Predicate.and(Predicate) - as first in the chain if we care about all arguments or as second if we only care about the succeeded.
        Type Parameters:
        T - generic type for inferrence
        Parameters:
        c - consumer operating on the predicate parameter
        Returns:
        a true predicate calling c on its argument/result

      • no

        @NotNull
public static <T> @NotNull Predicate<T> no(@NotNull
                                                    @NotNull Consumer<T> c)
        Creates a fixed value false predicate, intercepting the predicate argument for inspection or manipulation. It can be used with Predicate.or(Predicate) - as first in the chain if we care about all arguments or as second if we only care about the succeeded.
        Type Parameters:
        T - generic type for inferrence
        Parameters:
        c - consumer operating on the predicate parameter
        Returns:
        a false predicate calling c on its argument/result

      • snoop

        @NotNull
public static <T> @NotNull Supplier<T> snoop(@NotNull
                                                      @NotNull Supplier<T> s,
                                                      @NotNull
                                                      @NotNull Consumer<T> c)
        Wraps a supplier, without changing its logic, intercepting the supplier result for inspection or manipulation.
        Type Parameters:
        T - generic type for inferrence
        Parameters:
        s - wrapped supplier
        c - consumer operating on the supplier results
        Returns:
        a supplier delegating to s, calling c on its result

      • snoop

        public static <T> Predicate<T> snoop(Predicate<T> p,
                                     Consumer<Boolean> c)
        Wraps a predicate, without changing its logic, intercepting the predicate result for inspection.
        Type Parameters:
        T - generic type for inferrence
        Parameters:
        p - wrapped predicate implementing some useful function
        c - consumer operating on the predicate parameter
        Returns:
        a predicate delegating to p, calling c on its result
